title: Vector Spatial Overlay Analysis
description: Real-world GIS application displaying multiple types of spatial information in a digestible format for general audiences.
fullDescription: Completed as part of Environ 531: GIS Principles. This project emphasizes the practical application of vector-based spatial analysis techniques to create clear, informative visualizations.

title: Suitability Analysis with Data Enrichment
description: Used stacked data queries and spatial overlay tools to identify regions of interest with Esri data enrichment.
fullDescription: Completed for Earth 309: GIS Explorations. This analysis incorporates Esri data enrichment capabilities for calculating detailed spatial statistics and demographic information.

title: San Andreas Fault Earthquake Risk Assessment
description: Comprehensive semester project assessing earthquake and liquefaction risk along the San Andreas fault.
fullDescription: This analysis combines geologic and demographic factors using raster calculations and spatial overlay tools to identify high-risk areas and vulnerable populations.

title: Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory Site Analysis
description: Spatial analysis and cartographic visualization of the Fermi Lab facility and surrounding area.
fullDescription: Detailed site analysis incorporating infrastructure, environmental features, and spatial relationships using professional cartographic design principles.

title: Automated Raster Suitability Analysis
description: Employed ArcGIS Model Builder and Python scripting to analyze multiple raster datasets.
fullDescription: Completed for Earth 408. This project uses automated workflow modeling to perform complex raster calculations and criteria-based filtering across multiple datasets.

title: Watershed Boundary Delineation
description: Used digital elevation models to calculate watershed boundaries, flow direction, and stream order.
fullDescription: Comprehensive hydrologic analysis using ArcGIS Hydrologic Modeling tools to understand watershed characteristics and water flow patterns.

title: 3D Terrain and Cost Path Analysis
description: Calculated optimal paths over digital elevation models showing how terrain affects pathfinding cost.
fullDescription: Created 3D terrain visualizations and performed cost-distance analysis to identify least-cost paths across complex topography.

title: Harmful Algal Bloom Formation Study
description: Final project conducting comprehensive watershed analysis to study HAB formation in local lakes.
fullDescription: This research project combines hydrologic modeling, water quality analysis, and spatial statistics to understand the environmental factors contributing to harmful algal bloom formation. Research presented in poster format.

title: Lake Michigan Bathymetry Visualization
description: Exploring bathymetry data visualization with various color palettes and cartographic styles.
fullDescription: Personal project using QGIS to create visually compelling representations of Lake Michigan's underwater topography through careful color selection and design.

title: Lake Superior Bathymetry Visualization
description: Cartographic exploration of Lake Superior's depth and underwater features.
fullDescription: Continuing the bathymetry series with Lake Superior, showcasing different color palettes and design approaches to represent the deepest of the Great Lakes.

title: Mumbai Elevation Visualization
description: Stylistic elevation visualization of Mumbai showcasing topographic variations.
fullDescription: Creative cartographic design exploring Mumbai's urban landscape through elevation data, emphasizing the relationship between topography and urban development.

title: UMS Ticket Office Venues Map
description: Custom map showcasing venue locations for the University Musical Society Ticket Office.
fullDescription: Practical mapping project combining functionality with aesthetic design to help patrons locate performance venues across the University of Michigan campus.
